newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-SAMPDORIA'S LATE EQUALISER KEEPS UP PRESSURE ON JUVE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SAMPDORIA'S LATE EQUALISER KEEPS UP PRESSURE ON JUVE.

text.p: Roberto Mancini's cheeky backheel set up David Balleri for a dramatic last-minute equaliser to give second-place Sampdoria a 1-1 draw at Fiorentina on Sunday and keep up the pressure on league leaders Juventus.

Unbeaten in their last five games, Sampdoria now have 29 points from 17 matches -- just one point fewer than Juventus although the European champions can widen that gap in a late-night match against Lazio at Rome's Olympic stadium.
Inter, third on 28 points, missed the chance to overtake Juve, losing at home to Bologna for the first time in 20 years.
Giancarlo Marocchi and Russian former Inter midfielder Igor Shalimov scored Bologna's goals.
Croat Mario Stanic's winner against Verona gave Parma their fourth successive victory to give them a share of fourth place with Vicenza, who surrendered a 2-0 lead to draw with Napoli.
Substitute Roberto Baggio saved Milan from another setback at Cagliari, setting up Christophe Dugarry's equaliser.
